node.title: ‘S.N.L.’ Gives Ted Cruz His Own Version of ‘Sesame Street’
node.alt: Kyle Mooney and Aidy Bryant played a knock-off Big Bird and Senator Ted Cruz on “S.N.L.,” in a parody of “Sesame Street” that recommended bathing in Borax to purge the Covid-19 vaccine.
node.description: The sketch show, hosted this weekend by Jonathan Majors, also featured a 10-minute performance from the musical guest Taylor Swift.
node.content: ["Back in 2012, when the then-Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney professed his affection for Big Bird but nonetheless vowed to cut funding for PBS, \u201cSaturday Night Live\u201d brought in Big Bird himself to explain that he wasn\u2019t a political creature and didn\u2019t \u201cwant to ruffle any feathers.\u201d", "Almost a decade later, after the fictional, good-natured Big Bird said in a tweet that he had received a Covid vaccine, he has drawn the ire of Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, who complained that the tweet was \u201cgovernment propaganda for your 5-year-old.\u201d", "This time around, \u201cS.N.L.\u201d didn\u2019t get the support of any actual Muppets, so the show created its own alternate version of \u201cSesame Street,\u201d which it called \u201cCruz Street.\u201d", "Aidy Bryant, who played Senator Cruz in the opening sketch, stood in front of what looked like a familiar brownstone and explained, \u201cFor 50 years I stood by as \u2018Sesame Street\u2019 taught our children dangerous ideas, like numbers and kindness.\u201d", "She continued: \u201cBut when Big Bird told children to get vaccinated against a deadly disease, I said enough. And I created my own \u2018Sesame Street,\u2019 called \u2018Cruz Street.\u2019 It\u2019s a gated community, where kids are safe from the woke government.\u201d", "Following the show\u2019s theme song, Bryant was joined by Cecily Strong as Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, toting what she said was an AR-15.", "Strong said she was \u201cjust taking a break from releasing the phone numbers of Republicans who voted for the infrastructure bill so they and their families get death threats, and I thought I\u2019d stop by.\u201d", "Bryant\u2019s Cruz was also visited by Kyle Mooney, dressed in a makeshift Big Bird costume that probably wasn\u2019t fabricated by Sesame Workshop. He said that in the week since he had gotten the vaccine, his feathers had fallen out (among other physical side effects he claimed to be experiencing).", "To help out Mooney, Bryant brought out Pete Davidson, who played the comedian and podcast host Joe Rogan. He offered his own unreliable remedies, which consisted of \u201czinc and ayahuasca and some horse medicine.\u201d", "Other cast members played alternate versions of \u201cSesame Street\u201d characters, including Alex Moffat and Mikey Day as Bert and Ernie; Chris Redd as a furry green creature called Oscar the Slouch (\u201cPapa Joe Biden gave me so many stimmies, I decided to quit working and live in this trash can\u201d); and Aristotle Athari as the Recount Count.", "And hey, for good measure, the sketch brought out Chloe Fineman as Britney Spears, newly released from her yearslong conservatorship. \u201cOh my God, you guys, we did it,\u201d she said.", "Spare a thought for all the men who discovered during the pandemic that they didn\u2019t know how to form adult friendships and are now bereft of peer groups.", "For their support \u2014 and for the benefit of their spouses and significant others \u2014 \u201cS.N.L.\u201d has given us the Man Park, a dog park-like place where these well-meaning recluses can come together and share useless trivia, argue about \u201cRick and Morty\u201d or communicate with one another simply by saying \u201cMarvel\u201d over and over.", "We\u2019re not saying we\u2019re the target audience for this particular service, but when Andrew Dismukes asked \u201cWho\u2019s the GOAT, Michael Jordan or Tom Brady?\u201d and Athari answered \u201cHow about Bo Burnham?\u201d it felt so real.", "Taylor Swift got only one song on the show, but boy did she make it count: She delivered a blistering, 10-minute rendition of \u201cAll Too Well\u201d from her newly released album of re-recordings, \u201cRed (Taylor\u2019s Version).\u201d", "Her performance \u2014 which ran even longer than Prince\u2019s fabled eight-minute, three-song medley from an \u201cS.N.L.\u201d appearance in 2014 \u2014 was accompanied by a short film that Swift directed, starring herself and the actors Sadie Sink and Dylan O\u2019Brien. The re-emergence of \u201cAll Too Well\u201d (a shorter version of which was originally released in 2012) has also resurfaced speculation on who the song might be about \u2014 speculation that the film seems to be reinforcing? \u2014 and we recommend that you give the song a full listen if you want to at least understand the leadoff joke on Weekend Update.", "Over at the Weekend Update desk, the anchors Colin Jost and Michael Che riffed on the indictment of Stephen Bannon, the Kyle Rittenhouse trial and, yes, Taylor Swift.", "Jost began:", "He continued:", "Che pivoted to Rittenhouse:"]
